intro: Seidelia triandra f. mercurialis, commonly known as the mercury saxifrage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant is native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia, thriving in rocky and sandy soils. It is adapted to cold climates and has a low-growing habit to withstand harsh environmental conditions. The species is often found in open habitats such as tundra and mountain slopes.
